This", "AHSAA announces fall reclassification Along with Friday’s historic announcement by the Alabama High School Athletic Association (AHSAA) concerning its separation of public and private schools in championship competition, was the announcement of the organization’s reclassification for the next athletic calendar, 2026-27. The public schools will be divided into six classifications instead of the seven of recent years, while the private schools will have two classifications. As in the past, schools will be classified based on enrollment. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content. Please enable it in your browser settings. Please log in, or sign up", "Strong first half is enough for Indiana to topple Chicago State Lamar Wilkerson scored a game-high 21 points Saturday and Indiana made 14 of its 15 3-pointers in the first half of a 78-58 nonconference home win over Chicago State in Bloomington. Reed Bailey came off the bench to add 17 points and eight rebounds, while Nick Dorn contributed 15 points on 5-of-11 shooting from the 3-point line. The Hoosiers (9-3) drew assists on all but two of their 26 field goals, with Conor Enright dishing out seven and Wilkerson handing out six. Name: 0_state_win_coach_federal
Representative_Docs: ["Kerr groups ready to help feed families cut off from SNAP due to shutdown Approximately 2,000 in Kerr County have not received November SNAP credits to their card since benefits ran out in October. Although the federal government shutdown is interfering with the Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program that helps millions of low-income families, Kerr County food assistance partners stand ready to fill the gap. In Kerr County, 2,013 households totaling 4,082 individuals have not received November SNAP credits to their card since benefits ran out in October, according to the Texas Health and Human Services Department. Javascript is required for you to be able to read premium content. Please enable it in your browser settings. Just click “Gift this Article” on this page, then copy the link or enter their email. Gifts are exclusive to subscribers, reset monthly, and each article can be redeemed once. The Tennessee Volunteers had a disappointing season after making their first College Football Playoff in 2024. The Volunteers, under the leadership of head coach Josh Heupel, finished the 2025 season with an 8-5 record. That was after being ranked as high as No. 11 in the country. However, the team struggled down the stretch, losing four of its final seven games. As a result, it is now focused on building a championship contender for the upcoming season. Drake's Isaiah Bragg returned the opening kickoff 32 yards to the Drake 34. Name: 1_family_parents_husband_friends
Representative_Docs: ['Asking Eric: Family, friends don’t seem to appreciate time I put into tedious Christmas cookie tradition Dear Eric: My late mother made a special Christmas cookie that required tedious decorating, considering each person’s personal preference for toppings, and giving them as gifts to family and friends. They always had a place of honor on our family Christmas table. When she was no longer able, she gave me the cookie cutter, and my daughters and I took over the family tradition. It takes the three of us several days to make, bake, decorate, package and mail cookies to family members around the country. We enjoy doing it and feel like we’re continuing the fun and festive tradition. However, in recent years, not all of the recipients acknowledge receipt. At some point in their lives, they have all helped Grandma decorate, so they know the time involved. Because of past delivery issues, I track the boxes and inquire if I haven’t heard from them in a couple of days. Last year, one response was “yes we got them.” This feels unappreciative! In the past most would text a picture of their children with the cookies, which we really enjoyed. We rarely see any of them anymore, as they are busy raising their families and don’t live nearby. This seems like a way for us to continue somewhat of a co', 'Asking Eric: Can mom work through tension in son’s relationship with dad so they can celebrate special birthday? Dear Eric: My son is turning 40 on December 22. My husband and I are at a quandary as to how to celebrate him. There have been issues between my husband and him over things from his childhood. We did a special trip for his older brother when he turned 40 and would like to do something special for this son’s 40th as well. Our daughter-in-law has made special plans for him and we are not included. I understand that, but I need some ideas as to how to celebrate this extra special year without rocking the boat. I love my son with all my heart, as I do all my children, and want his 40th birthday to be memorable in a positive way. Any suggestions? – Mom Who Wants to Celebrate Dear Mom: The issues your son and your husband are having may be an obstacle, but they aren’t insurmountable. And the thing that can get them on the path to resolution is the same thing that can get you answers about how to celebrate your son: open communication. It’s not within your purview to try to fix things between them, but you have your own relationship with your son and so I’d encourage you to reach out and tell him what you told me: you want to celebrate him, you know things are difficult, and you’re lookin', 'Asking Eric: After 6 years sober, man is frustrated by his family’s hold on their hurt and distrust Dear Eric: I’ve just turned 40 this past year. The last 15 years I was in a horrible drug addiction. I lied and hurt and did terrible things to a lot of people, especially my family. About eight years ago they officially disowned me. Understandable. I’ve cleaned up and got my act together six years ago. At first, I tried to force my way back into their lives, which all refuted. I lashed out, said horrible things and stopped trying to be in their lives. My mom will stop by on my birthday for 10 minutes or so and drop a card off at Christmas. As for my two older brothers and my father, it’s radio silence. I guess what I’m asking is, what do I do to fix this and fast, as I said I’ve turned 40 this year, my parents are both 70. Time is running out, and I couldn’t imagine living my life without some kind of acceptance from my father. Or knowing he did or does love me. My heart breaks at the thought, but this is a real pickle. How can I fix a problem when the ones I need to fix it with won’t talk to me? Do I just keep ignoring their existence and put on this façade that I don’t care to my wife and 4-year-old son? What picture am I painting to my son, as he’s been guilty by association yo']

Name: 3_actor_actors_actress_cast
Representative_Docs: ["AP Entertainment SummaryBrief at 3:08 p.m. EST Brendan Fraser's new horizons include 'Rental Family' and rental hedgehogs BEDFORD, N.Y. (AP) — “Rental Family” is Brendan Fraser’s first leading role since winning the best actor Oscar for “The Whale.” In it, the 56-year-old plays a struggling actor living in Japan who, out of desperation and curiosity, takes a job with an agency that hires out actors to fulfill roles in real people’s lives. In an interview, Fraser discusses his life since the Oscar win, his eye-opening experiences in Japan and what returning to the “Mummy” series means to him. His time in Japan included a visit to a hedgehog cafe. “Rental Family” opens Friday in theaters. Copyright 2025 The Associated Press. All rights reserved. Edgerton stars alongside Felicity Jones and William H. Macy in the meditative film. Name: 4_surgical_surgery_hospital_patients
Representative_Docs: ['VIDEO: $5.5M robotic surgery system arrives at Surrey Memorial Hospital Published 12:10 pm Tuesday, January 27, 2026 By Anna Burns The da Vinci Xi System has been unpacked and calibrated and is being held in a temporary location until its permanent location is finished. Fraser Health said that it expects it to “go-live” later in the spring. (Fraser Health/ Contributed to Surrey Now-Leader) Health care workers pose in front of the da Vinci Xi System. (Fraser Health/ Contributed to Surrey Now-Leader) Surrey Memorial Hospital is one step closer to providing robotic-assisted surgery with the arrival of the da Vinci Xi Robotic Surgery system. It is expected to be used in surgeries in the spring. “With the aid of the da Vinci Xi system, we can expand minimally invasive thoracic and foregut surgery, and we can do operations with greater precision and accuracy,” says Dr Ahmad Ashrafi, regional division head and chief of thoracic surgery for Fraser Health. “Patients may experience quicker recovery times, and we can carry out more complex procedures right here in Surrey, using minimally invasive techniques. This advanced technology will also help us attract and retain top surgical talent at Surrey Memorial Hospital.” Construction is underway on an operating room', 'VIDEO: $5.5M robotic surgery system arrives at Surrey Memorial Hospital Published 12:10 pm Tuesday, January 27, 2026 By Anna Burns The da Vinci Xi System has been unpacked and calibrated and is being held in a temporary location until its permanent location is finished. Name: 5_museum_world largest_tourism_exhibition
Representative_Docs: ["Egypt unveils the world's largest museum dedicated to a single civilization Egypt is inaugurating on Saturday the Grand Egyptian Museum, two decades in the making, with the aim of drawing more visitors to revitalize the country's tourist industry. Located just outside Cairo on the Giza Plateau which also includes the three pyramids and the Sphinx, the museum will be the world’s largest dedicated to a single civilization. It will display over 50,000 artifacts detailing life in ancient Egypt. World leaders, including monarchs, heads of states and governments, are set to attend the grand opening ceremony, according to the Egyptian presidency which touted the museum as “an exceptional event in the history of human culture and civilization.” The museum is one of the megaprojects championed by President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi since he took office in 2014. He has embarked on massive investments in infrastructure with the aim of reviving an economy weakened by decades of stagnation and battered by the unrest that followed the 2011 Arab Spring uprising. Preparations for the grand reveal have been shrouded in secrecy. The museum, which was opened for limited visits in recent years, has been closed for the past two weeks. Name: 6_central bank_federal reserve_meeting_italy
Representative_Docs: ['Florence Press Conference Confirms ECB Remains Comfortable in Its Good Place Even a change of scenery has done nothing to change the European Central Bank’s current wait-and-see stance. Florence, where the ECB met today for its only annual meeting outside of Frankfurt, is apparently also this ’good place’, the central bank’s well-known pseudonym for comfortably keeping interest rates on hold. ECB President Christine Lagarde even called it a ‘magnificent’ place – Florence, that is, not rates. The comments at the press conference confirmed once again that the ECB has no intention to leave its ‘good place’ any time soon. We had feared a rather uneventful press conference. What should we say? We hate to be right… Anyhow, here are a few interesting remarks made by Lagarde: On the ECB’s risk assessment, the introductory statement had the most remarkable change compared with September. Last month, the ECB had still talked about risks to the growth outlook that had become “more balanced”; today, it refrained from qualifying any balance of risk. Instead, the central bank had a somewhat more extensive list of upside and downside risks to the growth outlook. Lagarde even said that some of the downside risks had abated. When asked whether this was a sign of an upcoming', 'Florence Press Conference Confirms ECB Remains Comfortable in Its Good Place Even a change of scenery has done nothing to change the European Central Bank’s current wait-and-see stance. Name: 7_contestants_dancing_chris_departure
Representative_Docs: ["UK Championship snooker referee is banned from officiating one player at the tournament A top snooker referee is barred from taking charge of one player's matches at the UK Championship - because she is married to him. Belarus-born Tatiana Woollaston, 38, will be one of the officials on duty at the first Triple Crown event of the season, which begins on Saturday. Another Woollaston will also be involved at the York Barbican, her husband Ben, who booked his place in the 32-player showpiece by coming through qualifying earlier this week. He is now looking forward to a first-round clash with three-time UK champion John Higgins on Saturday night. However, there is no chance of Tatiana taking charge of the match. She told the Mirror ahead of last year's UK Championship that they try to keep their respective snooker careers as separate as possible. We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you've consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You can unsubscribe at any time. Read our Privacy Policy She said: “He’s on the circuit as a player, I’m on the circuit as a referee. We’ve never really mix that. I’m obviously not allowed to referee his games and I wouldn’t want to, to be fair.” H", 'Strictly Come Dancing fans have same complaint as La Voix withdraws from show \'Pointless!\' Strictly Come Dancing fans have been left with the same question after it was announced La Voix has withdrawn from the competition. During Saturday (November 22) night\'s show, the remaining contestants took to the dance floor at the iconic Blackpool Tower Ballroom. Before things kicked off for Blackpool Week, presenter Tess Daly informed viewers that the drag queen – real name Chris Dennis – would not be returning to the competition after sustaining a foot injury. She said: "We can confirm she has very sadly had to withdraw from the competition," before revealing there would be no elimination this weekend. But this has left fans wondering why Sunday night\'s show is still airing now that there is no dance-off. Taking to social media with their queries, one wrote: "So what’s the point of Sunday’s show when everything can be done tonight #Strictly?" Read more: Strictly pro says only one person can replace Craig Revel Horwood Read more: BBC Strictly viewers switch off as major star pulls out of show We use your sign-up to provide content in ways you\'ve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. This may include adverts from us and 3rd parties based on our understanding. You', 'Strictly Come Dancing star breaks silence after concern fifth contestant would quit Strictly Come Dancing\'s Alex Kingston is poised to carry on with her dance adventure, putting to rest concerns she might have to withdraw due to injury. The 62-year-old actress had triggered concerns about a potential exit after her daughter disclosed a rib injury on social media, stating that her mother had endured the discomfort to participate in Saturday\'s programme. The Doctor Who legend, who has been dazzling audiences on the dance floor alongside partner Johannes Radebe, was swift to comfort her supporters that injuries were simply "part and parcel" of the Strictly experience, and she had absolutely no plans to retire her dancing shoes. Fleur East, host of Strictly spin-off It Takes Two, has now verified that Alex will return to the competition following last week\'s Blackpool special. Discussing their forthcoming performance, Fleur disclosed: "Alex and Johannes will be dancing a cha-cha-cha to Ring My Bell by Anita Ward." Name: 8_africa_school students_south africa_tourists
Representative_Docs: ['Minnesota high schoolers prepare for once-in-lifetime learning trip to Africa ASHBY, Minn. — There are field trips and there are field trips. Students at Ashby High School are busy raising money and getting ready to pack their bags for a two-week learning experience in South Africa. ADVERTISEMENT When it is below zero, the main street in Ashby, Minnesota, is quiet. Fewer than 500 people call this Grant County town home, but lately the town is busy rallying around a group of high school students. In the basement of Peace Grue Lutheran in the middle of town, five high school students join veteran church quilters in tying quilts that the students will take on their trip to South Africa. "There is a reason the church ladies do this and not the guys," joked Kevin Fick, the girls\' weightlifting coach and organizer of the trip, of tying quilts the students will take with them as gifts. Five girls, along with Fick and four adult chaperones, will make the trip to Eastern Cape, South Africa, from Feb. 28 through March 10. Not as tourists, but to learn about conservation on another continent. "Not a lot of kids get to do this," said student Hadley Hokanson, student. They will work a sheep ranch, fish for sharks, harvest their own food, camp in the bushes and more.
